item.description:
Note: This tour was originally to be Part 2 (with Part 1 having taken place on June 6). However, the June 6 tour was cancelled due to a thunderstorm. So, Part 1 will take place on June 13 as detailed below.


Pine Grove Cemetery Walking Tour - Part 1
Sunday, June 13, 2010
At the Millyard Museum
1:30 p.m.-3:30 p.m.
$5 Manchester Historic Association members; $10 general public
Pre-registration is required.

Part 2 of this walking tour will be scheduled in the Fall.

Local Historian John Jordan will lead this two-part tour through Manchester's only active municipal cemetery. The cemetery was first developed in 1851. Over the years the city made several additional land purchases, until the cemetery grew to around 275 acres.

Many of Manchester's most prominent citizens were buried at Pine Grove. These include philanthropist Frank P. Carpenter, industrialist George A. Leighton and 13 Manchester mayors. Also buried there are some now forgotten people whose compelling stories will be retold. The cemetery includes beautiful monuments of many different designs, the Ursula Chapel built in 1905, the City Mausoleum built in 1980, and 17 family mausoleums.
item.name: Pine Grove Cemetery Walking Tour - Part 1
